sections.name: Goblin Bat-Dog
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence ability modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

traits.name: Mutant
traits.text: The monster has mutated or evolved, granting it unusual benefits, drawbacks, or both.

automatic_abilities.name: Irritating Dander
automatic_abilities.text: A creature that hits a goblin bat-dog with an unarmed attack, tries to Grapple it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to goblin pox.

affliction.name: Goblin Pox

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

affliction.context: Goblins and goblin dogs (including goblin bat-dogs) are immune to goblin pox.

stages.name: Stage 3
stages.text: sickened 2 and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day)

license.name: OPEN GAME LICENSE Version 1.0a
